com.here.android.mpa.search

Class Request<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.search.Request<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Data type for results
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscoveryRequest, GeocodeRequest, MediaCollectionPageRequest, PlaceRequest, ReverseGeocodeRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest, TransitSchedulePageRequest

    public abstract class Request<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a base class for a search request.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Request.Connectivity
      Represents values describing possible types of connectivity that the request is performed.

    • Field Detail

      • PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME
        Name used to get core POI identifier references.

        Use DiscoveryRequest.addReference(String) to be able to retrieve the POI identifier from the returned PlaceLink (using PlaceLink.getReference(String)).

        The POI identifier can also be retrieved using DiscoveryRequest.addReference(String) and PlaceLink.getReference(String) (or PlaceRequest.addReference(String) and Place.getReference(String)).

        See Also:
        Places (Search) API Developer's Guide, DiscoveryRequest.addReference(String), PlaceLink.getReference(String), PlaceRequest.addReference(String), Place.getReference(String), Constant Field Values

      • PLACE_CONTENT_WIKIPEDIA

        public static final java.lang.String PLACE_CONTENT_WIKIPEDIA
        Name used to get editorial wikipedia content in place details response.

        Use PlaceRequest.addContent(String) to specify Request.PLACE_CONTENT_WIKIPEDIA content source in PlaceRequest.

        See Also:
        Places (Search) API Developer's Guide, PlaceRequest.getContent(), Place.getEditorials(), EditorialMedia, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public ErrorCode execute(@NonNull
                         ResultListener<T> eventListener)
        Executes an asynchronous request.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - A ResultListener passed along with the request to monitor progress
        Returns:
        The ErrorCode representing an appropriate result
        Note:
        The ErrorCode.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE can be returned if current search service is unavailable for your region. For more information see the Developer's Guide.

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel()
        Cancels any pending results from an invoked request.
        Returns:
        True if the request was canceled successfully, false otherwise

      • getCollectionSize

        protected int getCollectionSize()
        Gets the current collection size being used for request responses.
        Returns:
        The current response collection size
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest

      • setCollectionSize

        @NonNull
protected Request<T> setCollectionSize(int value)
        Sets a collection size to be used for request responses. The maximum number of result items in each collection will be limited to this value. The valid value range is [1..100]. The default collection size is 20.
        Parameters:
        value - Desired response collection size size per request.
        Returns:
        This Request object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is out of range.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest

      • addReference

        @NonNull
protected Request<T> addReference(@NonNull
                                           java.lang.String name)
        This function adds the name of a requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.

        For example, to retrieve POI identifier, set this value to Request.PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of reference identifier to retrieve.
        Returns:
        True if name added, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, PlaceRequest

      • getReferences

        @NonNull
protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReferences()
        This function returns the names of requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.
        Returns:
        List of the names of reference identifiers to be returned in the result.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, PlaceRequest

      • setConnectivity

        public void setConnectivity(Request.Connectivity connectivity)
        Sets the connectivity of request. By default, the connectivity of request is controlled by the SDK. If the SDK is online then an online request will be made. If the SDK is offline then an offline request will be made. Be aware, OFFLINE request can return limited result details. Results from ONLINE request will provide the best information available.
        Parameters:
        connectivity - Desired request connectivity.

      • getConnectivity

        public Request.Connectivity getConnectivity()
        This function returns the connectivity of request.
        Returns:
        The request connectivity.

      • setMapViewport

        @NonNull
protected Request<T> setMapViewport(@NonNull
                                             GeoBoundingBox mapViewport)
        The map viewport is a bounding box of the map area currently visible to the user. The viewport can act as an implicit location context in the absence of an explicit location context. To ensure you get the best results possible, you should always set a viewport if there is a map visible to the user.
        Parameters:
        mapViewport - The bounding box of the map area currently visible.
        Returns:
        The updated Request object itself.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest

      • setUserAuthentication

        @NonNull
public Request<T> setUserAuthentication(@NonNull
                                                 java.lang.String token)
        Some requests, such as when posting images or reviews, applications must provide an OAuth 2.0 bearer token (obtained from HERE Account) to authenticate the user performing the action. The procedure for obtaining a token is outside of the scope of this documentation. Please refer to the HERE Account Single Sign On (SSO) API documentation for more information.
        Parameters:
        token - The User authentication bearer token.
        Returns:
        The updated Request object itself.

                            java.lang.String name,

                      java.util.Locale locale)

        Parameters:

      • getLocale

        @Nullable
public java.util.Locale getLocale()
